intro: Cotoneaster camilli-schneideri, commonly known as the Camilli-Schneider cotoneaster, is a species of shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and red or orange berries. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value due to its vibrant autumn foliage and attractive fruit. However, it is considered an invasive species in some areas outside its native range.
